results.abstract: The Washington “swamp” President Trump likes to denounce is still teeming with life — and it is converging on lawmakers drafting tax legislation.

media.caption: The Port of Charleston in South Carolina last year. Proposed tax changes are pitting retail and energy giants — which rely heavily on imports — against America’s biggest manufacturers, which hope the changes will make their exports cheaper.

results.adx_keywords: Federal Taxes (US);House of Representatives;Senate;Republican Party;United States Politics and Government;Lobbying and Lobbyists

results.abstract: Her subversiveness and underplayed chic have transformed the actress, an Oscar contender, into fashion’s unlikely new muse.

media.copyright: Brad Torchia for The New York Times
media.caption: Isabelle Huppert won best actress in the drama category at the Golden Globes last month for her role in “Elle.” She is up for an Academy Award this weekend.

results.title: Isabelle Huppert: ‘The Best Way to Please Is Not to Please’

results.abstract: Over the last three years, iPads and Mac notebooks have steadily lost ground to Chromebooks, inexpensive laptops that run on Google’s Chrome operating system.
